intro: Didymoplexis torricellensis, commonly known as the Torricelli's didymoplexis, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found growing in humid, shaded environments along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth.
